page.title: 04FROM A SESSAY WINDOW
page.content: The milkman delivers at 5.30am, then peace, before farming activity begins. At 8.20am Smith's coach collects secondary-school children; from then on a continuous stream of vehicles and cyclists goes along to school. Later the post van and newspaper lady's car can be seen. The milk lorry calls at the farm and at 11.30am playschool closes and the library van makes its fortnightly call. On Thursdays people visit the Post Office for pensions and later cars return to collect school children. The fish van makes its weekly visit and at 4.15pm the coach returns with the Thirsk school children. The twice-weekly grocery and butcher's vans can be seen around teatime and early evening sees people and cars going to the village hall for meetings and sporting activities.
